meta.name: Generate personalized cold email icebreakers with Apify, Baserow and OpenRouter GPT-4.1

parameters.text:
You're provided a scrape of a whole website in HTML Markdown. Your task is to provide a three-paragraph abstract of what this website is about.



Rules:
- These are Realtor/Real Estate websites so generate responses fit for a website of such niche.
- Your extract should be comprehensive—similar level of detail as an abstract to a published paper.
- Use a straightforward, spartan tone of voice.
- If it's empty or invalid, just say "no content".
- If you are not provided the content, say 'no content'.

messageValues.message: You're a helpful, intelligent website scraping assistant.

parameters.text:
You’ll receive one or more website overviews of Med Spas along with the person’s name. Your job is to turn that into a catchy, personalized icebreaker for a cold email. Randomly choose one of the Icebreaker Templates below exactly as written, and fill in the variables with details from the website overview:

Icebreaker Templates:
• “Hey {firstName}. Love {thing}, also into {otherThing}. Wanted to run something by you.
I hope you’ll forgive me, but I creeped through your page/site a bit, and it’s pretty clear that {anotherThing} matters a lot to you (or at least that’s what I’m getting from the focus on {fourthThing}).”

• “Hey {firstName}, noticed how {thing} and {otherThing} are a focus for your brand. It got me thinking about {theirSocialPresenceDetail}, so thought I should get your take on something.”

After you write the icebreaker, create a personalized Subject Line by choosing one of the Subject Line Templates below. Make sure the subject line is based only on something meaningful from the icebreaker you just wrote.

Subject Line Templates:
• “Wanted to get your take on something.”
• “This might feel random… but”
• “{firstName}, I swear this isn’t weird”

Rules:
- These are the overviews for Realtor/Real Estate websites, so generate your responses fit for a website of such niche.
- Write in a spartan, laconic tone.
- Stick to the chosen icebreaker template exactly and insert the variables naturally.
- Output in Plain Text only.
- Shorten company names whenever possible (like “Mayo” instead of “Mayo Inc.”).
- Shorten locations too (like “San Fran” instead of “San Francisco”).
-  When talking about metrics, don't mention the exact number but round off to the nearest tens or hundreds. For Example, don't say "751 reviews"; instead, say "700+ reviews."
- For the variables, highlight small, non-obvious details from the website. Avoid generic lines like “Love your website.”
- Don’t label the output as “Icebreaker:” or “Subject:”.
- The subject line must be a single sentence.
- Use simple spoken American English.
- Make sure the subject line includes the person’s first name if the template requires it.

Your final output must include the icebreaker first, followed by the subject line, both using the templates above.

messageValues.message: You're a helpful, intelligent sales assistant.

Hey Sarah. Love your color-coded meal guides, also into the way you mix quick recipes with longer weekend ones. Wanted to run something by you. I hope you’ll forgive me, but I dug through your site a bit, and it’s pretty clear that keeping meal planning stress-free matters a lot to you (or at least that’s what I’m getting from the focus on those “no-prep weekday” posts).

Hey Mia, noticed how your travel guides and those quick packing-tip clips are a focus for your brand. It got me thinking about how you keep your feed’s momentum, so thought I should get your take on something.

parameters.content: ## Scrape Main URL and get all the links on the page
## Insert Icebreaker & Subject Line & Website Overview into the Database

## Scrape provided URL(s) and get their HTML. Using 'Markdown', get rid of the HTML jargon. Then limit the material of the page(s) to 5000 characters. Finally, combine all data into one array. Retries using apify
## Convert the half URL(s) into full

## Detailed: Filters through to find desired pages.   
- If desired don't exist, then 'fallback' pages are sent forward.

- The total output will always be 5 (if enough links are available).

- If the output has a low (less than 4) number of 'primary' pages, then it fills the gaps with 'fallback' pages.

- It always outputs the Original URL and outputs it as the first item of the list, ensuring the main page gets scraped.

- If no 'primary' and no 'fallback' pages exist, it outputs the original URL, ensuring the workflow stays running.

- Gets rid of extra variants of the original URL.

- Outputs the array of URLs along with the First Name of the lead because the latter nodes are freaking out and not finding the name.

- An extra bit 'pairs' the First Name and the URL array so that the latter nodes know which set of info the URL(s) belong to.

_Has some extra bits of code (Normalization & Deduplication), but we HAVE TO KEEP them because it doesn't work without them. It reverses the order (which can easily be fixed by removing sorting, but we don't want to mess with it), and returns extra variants of the original URL. IF IT WORKS DON'T TOUCH IT!_

parameters.content:
## Passes Directly if Atleast 1 scrape was successful else uses the Apify scraper

- #### Code node grabs all data items and urls.

--- If 'data' exists (even if only 1), it outputs: 'hasData=true', if not then outputs 'hasData=false'

- #### The IF node checks if 'hasData' is 'true'.

--- If 'hasData' is true then the workflow only uses the successful website scrape.

--- If 'hasData' is 'false' or if no scrape was successful, only then it forwards the 'urls' to the Apify scraper.

nodes.name: data or content both get forwarded

parameters.content:
## Overview
This workflow researches each lead’s website and generates a personalized cold outreach subject line and icebreaker using real website content. It replaces manual research with structured scraping and AI-driven analysis, helping you send outreach that feels relevant instead of generic.

If a website is unreachable or broken, the workflow records `no content` so faulty leads are easy to identify.

## How It Works
1. Pulls leads from the database (Baserow by default).
2. Fetches and scrapes the lead’s website.
3. Extracts and filters internal links only.
4. Scrapes up to five pages total, including the main page.
5. Converts content to markdown and trims each page to control token usage.
6. Aggregates all pages into a single input.
7. Uses an LLM to generate a short business overview.
8. Uses a second LLM to generate a personalized subject line and icebreaker.
9. Updates the database with the generated outputs.

## Setup Steps
1. Add your Apify API key for website scraping.
2. Connect your Baserow credentials (Airtable or Google Sheets can be used instead).
3. Add your LLM API key (OpenRouter is used here).
4. Map the database fields for name, website, company name, and outputs.
5. Test with a small batch before running at scale.
6. Change Rule 1 of the Website Overview AI node to match the niche of the website you are scraping

## Use Cases
- Cold email personalization at scale  
- Sales and SDR research automation  
- Agency and founder-led outbound workflows

## To understand how to get the URL with embedded API

Open the Apify Scraper or Apify Scraper2 node. And in the URLs field, you will see a URL of the actor along with a placeholder API.
Grab the URL from after "...v2/acts/" up to before "/run_sync_dataset...", and paste it in the Apify store's search bar to find the used Actor.

For example:
If the URL is "https://api.apify.com/v2/acts/apify~website-content-crawler/run-sync-get-dataset-items?token=apify_api_<YOUR API KEY>"
Then you grab "apify~website-content-crawler".

nodes.name: Converts HTML into easily readable format

parameters.content:
## Shorten the HTML

- It removes the extra parts of HTML such as '<div>, <body>, <title>' tags to help save token usage

## Filters through to find desired pages. 
- Desired pages are mentioned in the code as 'keywords'
- If need to change the kind of pages, then change the words in the 'keywords' constant

- Detailed working of the node mentioned in the Sticky Note Above
## Limit the material of the page(s) to 5000 characters

## LLM for generating Website Overview and Personalized Emails

### The Website Overview Node:
- Takes the website scrape and uses it to create a 3-paragraph overview of said site.
- Has error handling and outputs 'no content' to prevent inaccurate info

### If Node:
- Only forwards the overview if it is not 'no content', to prevent wasted AI generations

### Icebreaker & Subject Node:
- Takes the Website Overview and uses it to create a personalized Icebreaker for the prospect.
-- The subject Line is generated with Fixed Templates, but you can edit the prompt to change that.
-- The Icebreaker is also created using templates, but you can change that too in the prompt.
-- This currently only generates the Icebreaker and Subject Line, Not the full Email.  Change the prompt as needed.


_The prompts are short and simple for easy editing_

main.node: Converts HTML into easily readable format
data or content both get forwarded
